name: Faron Livinus
bio: is a second year in the college, double majoring in Anthropology and Visual Arts. They enjoy working on student-made films, with roles ranging from acting to directing, playing rugby, and doodling on their homework assignments.

name: Emma Beane
bio: is a third-year physics and English double-major. Her UT credits include Troilus and Cressida (Cressida) and The Tempest (Prospero), and she was a member of the acting ensemble in the TAPS Pro Show Happy Birthday Mars Rover. She is thrilled to be among incredible cast-mates and crew working to bring this play to life. Because she is biased, her favorite tyrant may be Prospero, especially when he's wearing overalls (ifykyk). She is so grateful for her friends who help her run lines and her family who always support and encourage her.

name: Sam Shaver
bio: is a second-year Anthropology and Religious Studies major. This is their first UT production, though they have been doing theatre since the age of eight and making questionable theatrical decisions ever since. Some of their past roles include Grace (Mirrors), Lawyer (Tracks), Rona Lisa Peretti (The 25th Annual Putnam County Spelling Bee), and others. Many thanks to John, Malaina, and Kayln for insisting they audition. They hope you enjoy the show! Their favorite tyrant is Ivan the Terrible, they relate to his chronic paranoia.

name: Ryan Witter
bio: is a third-year Linguistics, Gender and Sexuality Studies, and Middle Eastern Studies major. He has previously appeared in The Taming of the Shrew (Vincentio/Curtis) and Richard III (Clarence/York/Derby) and is excited to make his stage debut speaking like a modern person. He's also worked on Troilus and Cressida (Director), As Y'all Like It (Co-Director), The Play That Goes Wrong (Props), and Arcadia (Asst. Props).

name: Gabriel Brumberg
bio: is a fourth-year Fundamentals and TAPS double-major. Previous academic credits include: UT: Cactus Flower (Julian); TAPS Department: The Ballad of Oedipus (Oedipus); UT: Twelfth Night (Feste). Other credits include: Shakespeare Theatre Company: Noura (Yazen); Pallas Theater Collective: Assassins (Billy); Variations Theater Company: Capriccio Radio (Noah); Fire Escape Films: The Scottish Play (Leo); and several workshopped readings of new plays. His favorite tyrant is Cincinnatus, if he can be called a tyrant.

name: Smyrna Osae
bio: is a second-year Comparative Human Development Major on the pre-law track. This is her first UT show. She is thankful to Lucy for sharing the opportunity to be a part of Red Rex. Her favorite tyrant is Hades from Hadestown!

name: Melanie Zhang
bio: is a third year majoring in TAPS, LLSO, and Comparative Literature. She acted in Happy Birthday Mars Rover this past fall, and she wants to thank you for coming to the show!
